AIStorageProviderProtocol Protocol Reference

Conforms to NSObject
Declared in AIStorageProviderProtocol.h

Overview

protocol for defining secure storage methods

– storeValueForKey:value:error: required method

Method to store any object securely into user defaults

- (BOOL)storeValueForKey:(nonnull NSString *)key value:(nonnull id<NSCoding>)object error:(NSError *_Nullable *_Nullable)error

Parameters

key

a string to identify the data on user defaults
object

any object to be securely stored
error

error object

Availability

1.0.0

Declared In

AIStorageProviderProtocol.h

– fetchValueForKey:error: required method

Method to fetch the object stored against the key provided

- (nullable id)fetchValueForKey:(nonnull NSString *)key error:(NSError *_Nullable *_Nullable)error

Parameters

key

a string to identify the data on user defaults
error

error object

Return Value

the object stored against the key provided

Availability

1.0.0

Declared In

AIStorageProviderProtocol.h

– removeValueForKey: required method

Method to delete the object stored against the key provided

- (void)removeValueForKey:(nonnull NSString *)key

Parameters

key

a string to identify the data on user defaults

Availability

1.0.0

Declared In

AIStorageProviderProtocol.h

– loadData:error: required method

Method to loadData

- (nullable NSData *)loadData:(nonnull id<NSCoding>)data error:(NSError *_Nullable *_Nullable)error

Parameters

data

data to be loaded It can be any customObject which confirms to NSCoding protocol
error

error object

Return Value

encrypted data

error

– getDeviceCapability required method

Method to check whether devices is rooted or not

- (nonnull NSString *)getDeviceCapability

Return Value
